subject: Football
lead_paragraph: N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell and DeMaurice Smith, the chief executive of the players union, have sent a joint memo to players emphasizing that the league’s policy on performance-enhancing drugs is still in place. The memo, which also reaffirms their support of the policy, comes in the wake of court decisions that blocked the N.F.L. from enforcing the suspension of two Minnesota Vikings for positive drug tests.
